page.title: 06Wild Flowers
page.content:
There were a lot of wild flowers on our walk from the Jackdaw Garage to Ixworth Thorpe.
We saw poppies, daisies, buttercups, wild roses, and umbrella plants. The poppies had hairy stalks and a bright red flower that looked very pretty in the corners of the fields. The daisies were smaller and had white petals with a yellow middle. The umbrella-plants were often very tall, some were as high as 2 metres, while some were only half a metre.
The walk is one of the prettiest in the area and is a good example of an old road as it might have looked before horses and carts became numerous!
